item.title: Marshall add a quote by Anthony M. Platt
item.description: "The working class had imposed upon them a sterile and authoritarian educational system which mirrored the ethos of the corporate workplace." -- Anthony M. Platt

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Amy Dacyczyn
item.description: "Tightwaddery without creativity is deprivation. When there is a lack of resourcefulness, inventiveness, and innovation, thrift means doing without. When creativity combines with thrift you may be doing it without money, but you are not doing without." -- Amy Dacyczyn

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Neil Peart
item.description: "I even felt a vicarious guilt, like a German meeting Jewish people in Poland who had never heard of the Holocaust, or that there were Jews in America, and trying to explain it to them. Ashea, I wished I could say. Ashea." -- Neil Peart

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Anthony de Mello
item.description:
"The philosopher [author:Diogenes|3213618] was eating bread and lentils for supper. He was seen by the philosopher [author:Aristippus|8136486], who lived comfortably by flattering the king. Said [author:Aristippus|8136486], '<i>If you would learn to be subservient to the king you would not have to live on lentils</i>.'
Said [author:Diogenes|3213618, 'Learn to live on lentils and you will not have to be subservient to the king"." -- Anthony de Mello

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Amy Dacyczyn
item.description: "The relationship between ethics and thrift can be summed up in one sentence. It is wrong to save money at the expense of others. Period." -- Amy Dacyczyn

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Neil Peart
item.description: "Could hell be a place where there is no self-respect? A place where people have no pride in their own existence or behavior, and thus would have none for anyone or anything else?" -- Neil Peart

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Neil Peart
item.description: "I can worship Nature, and that fulfills my need for miracles and beauty. Art gives a spiritual depth to existence -- I can find worlds bigger and deeper than my own in music, paintings, and books. And from my friends and family I receive the highest benediction, emotional contact, and personal affirmation. I can bow before the works of Man, from buildings to babies, and that fulfills my need for wonder. I can believe in the sanctity of Life, and that becomes the Revealed Word, to live my life as I believe it should be, not as I'm told to by self-appointed guides." -- Neil Peart

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Jonathan Barnes
item.description: "The doctrine of the mean (the epithet 'golden' is un-Aristotelian) regularly occurs in later writers as a piece of moral advice -- a recipe or rule reminding us to 'observe the mean', to be moderate in all things and to avoid excess and deciciency. (If the doctrine urges us not to drink too much wine, it equally urges us not to drink too little -- but that is something which the moralizers usually find it prudent to ignore.)" -- Jonathan Barnes

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Stephen Jay Gould
item.description: "Skepticism is the agent of reason against organized irrationalism--and is therefore one of the keys to human social and civic decency." -- Stephen Jay Gould

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Daniel Quinn
item.description: "If the world is saved, it will not be saved by old minds with new programs but by new minds with no programs at all." -- Daniel Quinn

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Daniel Quinn
item.description: "Our lifestyle is evolutionarily unstable--and is therefore in the process of eliminating itself in the perfectly ordinary way." -- Daniel Quinn

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Daniel Quinn
item.description: "There is no one right way to live." -- Daniel Quinn

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Baruch Spinoza
item.description: "I have made a ceaseless effort not to ridicule, not to bewail, not to scorn human actions, but to understand them." -- Baruch Spinoza

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer
item.description: "Friends are God's way of apologizing for your family." -- Dr. Wayne W. Dyer

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Evelyn Beatrice Hall
item.description: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it." -- Evelyn Beatrice Hall

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "You never change things by fighting the existing reality. To change something, build a new model that makes the existing model obsolete." -- Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Warren Farrell
item.description: "It is in the interests of both sexes to hear the other sex's experience of powerlessness." -- Warren Farrell

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "I think it only makes sense to seek out and identify structures of authority, hierarchy, and domination in every aspect of life, and to challenge them; unless a justification for them can be given, they are illegitimate, and should be dismantled, to increase the scope of human freedom." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Craig O'Hara
item.description: "Anarchy does not simply mean no laws, it means no need for laws. Anarchy requires individuals to behave responsibly. When individuals can live in peace without authorities to compel or punish them, when people have enough courage and sense to speak honestly and equally with each other, then and only then, will anarchy be possible." -- Craig O'Hara

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Warren Farrell
item.description: "Every day in about half the advertisements, a man sees the constant reminder of the woman he was not worthy of." -- Warren Farrell

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noah Levine
item.description: "The truth is, going against the internal stream of ignorance is way more rebellious than trying to start some sort of cultural revolution." -- Noah Levine

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noah Levine
item.description: "It's easy to hate and point out everything that is wrong with the world; it is the hardest and most important work in one's life to free oneself from the bonds of fear and attachment." -- Noah Levine

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noah Levine
item.description: "The inner revolution will not be televised or sold on the Internet. It must take place within one's own mind and heart." -- Noah Levine

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Buckminster Fuller
item.description: "Don't fight forces; use them." -- Buckminster Fuller

item.title: Marshall add a quote by John C. Bogle
item.description: "The mutual fund industry has been built, in a sense, on witchcraft." -- John C. Bogle

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "I have learnt through bitter experience the one supreme lesson to conserve my anger, and as heat conserved is transmuted into energy, even so our anger controlled can be transmuted into a power which can move the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Strength does not come from physical capacity. It comes from an indomitable will." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Science is a bit like the joke about the drunk who is looking under a lamppost for a key that he has lost on the other side of the street, because that's where the light is. It has no other choice." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "Most problems of teaching are not problems of growth but helping cultivate growth. As far as I know, and this is only from personal experience in teaching, I think about ninety percent of the problem in teaching, or maybe ninety-eight percent, is just to help the students get interested. Or what it usually amounts to is to not prevent them from being interested. Typically they come in interested, and the process of education is a way of driving that defect out of their minds. But if children['s] ... normal interest is maintained or even aroused, they can do all kinds of things in ways we don't understand." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Marshall add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Napoleon said of Massena, that he was not himself until the battle began to go against him; then, when the dead began to fall in ranks around him, awoke his powers of combination, and he put on terror and victory as a robe. So it is in rugged crises, in unweariable endurance, and in aims which put sympathy out of question, that the angel is shown." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
